symbols.doc: The symbols used in the schema to specify e.g. dimensions of arrays.

symbol.name: n_ions
symbol.doc: The total number of ions in the reconstruction.

symbol.name: n_v_tri
symbol.doc: The number of vertices of the alpha complex.

symbol.name: n_f_tri
symbol.doc: The number of faces of the alpha complex.

symbol.name: n_f_tri_xdmf
symbol.doc: The total number of XDMF values to represent all faces of triangles via XDMF.

symbol.name: n_f_tet_xdmf
symbol.doc: The total number of XDMF values to represent all faces of tetrahedra via XDMF.

definition.doc: Results of a paraprobe-surfacer tool run.

attribute.name: version
attribute.doc: Version specifier of this application definition.

field.name: definition
field.doc: Official NeXus NXDL schema with which this file was written.

field.name: program
field.doc: Given name of the program/software/tool with which this NeXus (configuration) file was generated.

attribute.name: version
attribute.doc: Ideally program version plus build number, or commit hash or description of ever persistent resources where the source code of the program and build instructions can be found so that the program can be configured ideally in such a manner that the result of this computational process is recreatable in the same deterministic manner.

field.name: analysis_identifier
field.doc: Ideally, a (globally persistent) unique identifier for referring to this analysis.

field.name: analysis_description
field.doc: Possibility for leaving a free-text description about this analysis.

field.name: start_time
field.doc: ISO 8601 formatted time code with local time zone offset to UTC information included when the analysis behind this results file was started, i.e. the paraprobe-tool executable started as a process.

field.name: end_time
field.doc: ISO 8601 formatted time code with local time zone offset to UTC information included when the analysis behind this results file were completed and the paraprobe-tool executable exited as a process.

field.name: config_filename
field.doc: The absolute path and name of the config file for this analysis.

attribute.name: version
attribute.doc: At least SHA256 strong hash of the specific config_file for tracking provenance.

field.name: results_path
field.doc: Path to the directory where the tool should store NeXus/HDF5 results of this analysis. If not specified results will be stored in the current working directory.

field.name: status
field.doc:
A statement whether the paraprobe-tool executable managed to process the analysis or failed prematurely.
This status is written to the results file after the end_time at which point the executable must not compute any analysis. Only when this status message is present and shows `success`, the user should consider the results. In all other cases it might be that the executable has terminated prematurely or another error occurred.

group.doc: If used, contact information and eventually details of at least the person who performed this analysis.
Details about the coordinate system conventions used.

The individual coordinate systems which should be used. Field names should be prefixed with the following controlled terms indicating which individual coordinate system is described:
* paraprobe * lab * specimen * laser * leap * detector * recon

group.name: window
group.doc: A bitmask which identifies which of the ions in the dataset were analyzed. Computations of alpha complexes may have filtered this ion set further but this process is deterministic.

field.name: number_of_ions
field.doc: Number of ions covered by the mask. The mask may be 0 for most.

field.name: bitdepth
field.doc: Number of bits assumed matching on a default datatype. (e.g. 8 bits for a C-style uint8).

field.name: mask
field.doc: The unsigned integer array representing the content of the mask. If padding is used the padded bits are set to 0. The mask is for convenience always as large as the entire dataset as it will be stored compressed anyway. The convenience feature with this is that then the mask can be decoded with numpy and mirrored against the evaporation_id array and one immediately can filter out all points that were used by the paraprobe. The length of the array adds to the next unsigned integer if the number of ions in the dataset is not an integer multiple of the bitdepth.

group.name: POINT_SET_WRAPPING
group.doc: Paraprobe-surfacer can be used to load a ROI that is the entire or a sub-set of the ion point cloud. In the point_cloud_wrapping process the tool computes a triangulated surface mesh which encloses the ROI/point cloud. This mesh can be seen as a model for the edge of the dataset. Different algorithms can be used with paraprobe-surfacer to create this mesh such as convex hulls, alpha-shapes as their generalization, or alpha wrappings. Ideally, the resulting mesh should be a watertight polyhedron. This polyhedron is not necessarily convex. For some algorithms there is no guarantee that the resulting mesh yields a watertight mesh.

group.name: window
group.doc: A bitmask which identifies exactly all those ions whose positions were considered when defining the filtered point set from which the alpha complex was then in fact computed. This window can be different to the entire window as irrelevant ions might have been filtered out to reduce the computational costs of the alpha complex analysis.

field.name: number_of_ions
field.doc: Number of ions covered by the mask. The mask value for most may be 0.

field.name: bitdepth
field.doc: Number of bits assumed matching on a default datatype. (e.g. 8 bits for a C-style uint8).

field.name: mask
field.doc: The unsigned integer array representing the content of the mask. If padding is used the padded bits are set to 0. The mask is for convenience always as large as the entire dataset as it will be stored compressed anyway. The convenience feature with this is that then the mask can be decoded with numpy and mirrored against the evaporation_id array and one immediately can filter out all points that were used by the paraprobe. The length of the array adds to the next unsigned integer if the number of ions in the dataset is not an integer multiple of the bitdepth.

group.name: triangle_set
group.doc: The set of triangles in the coordinate system paraprobe which discretizes the exterior surface of the alpha complex.

field.name: identifier_offset
field.doc: Integer which specifies the first index to be used for distinguishing triangles. Identifiers are defined either implicitly or explicitly. For implicit indexing the identifiers are defined on the interval [identifier_offset, identifier_offset+c-1].

field.name: number_of_vertices
field.doc: Number of vertices.

field.name: number_of_faces
field.doc: Number of faces.

field.name: xdmf_topology
field.doc: A list of as many tuples of XDMF topology key, XDMF number of vertices and a triple of vertex indices specifying each triangle. The total number of entries is n_f_tri * (1+1+3).

field.name: is_watertight
field.doc: Do the triangles define a triangulated surface mesh which is watertight?

field.name: volume
field.doc: The volume which the triangulated surface mesh encloses provided that the mesh is watertight.

group.name: interior_tetrahedra
group.doc: The set of tetrahedra which represent the interior volume of the complex if that is a closed 2-manifold.

field.name: identifier_offset
field.doc: Integer which specifies the first index to be used for distin- guishing tetrahedra. Identifiers are defined either implicitly or explicitly. For implicit indexing the identifiers are defined on the interval [identifier_offset, identifier_offset+c-1]. For explicit indexing the identifier array has to be defined.

field.name: volume
field.doc: The accumulated volume of all interior tetrahedra.

field.name: number_of_vertices
field.doc: Number of vertices.

field.name: number_of_faces
field.doc: Number of faces.

field.name: xdmf_topology
field.doc: A list of as many tuples of XDMF topology key, XDMF number of vertices and a triple of vertex indices specifying each triangle. The total number of entries is n_f_tet * (1+1+4).

group.name: TRIANGLE_SET_WRAPPING
group.doc: In the future we may want to wrap other primitives like triangles or polylines.

field.name: number_of_processes
field.doc: Specify if it was different from the number_of_processes in the NXcs_profiling super class.

field.name: number_of_threads
field.doc: Specify if it was different from the number_of_threads in the NXcs_profiling super class.

field.name: number_of_gpus
field.doc: Specify if it was different from the number_of_threads in the NXcs_profiling super class.
